annotation: The user wants to find the height of the isosceles triangular face of a triangular prism. The problem provides the lengths of the three sides of the triangle and the length of the prism. The length of the prism is irrelevant information. The height of the triangle can be found by applying the Pythagorean theorem to the right-angled triangle formed by the height, half of the base, and one of the equal sides.
problem_text_en:
Consider the following figure. The height of the solid is 16cm.

Use Pythagoras' Theorem to find the unknown height $x$ in the solid shown.
